sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K1537018
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: F2A is from foot-and-mouth disease virus.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The 18~22 amino acids 2A self-cleaving oligopeptides can be used for co-expression of multiple, discrete proteins from a single ORF.Based on highly inefficient peptide bond formation between glycine and proline residues within the 2A peptide, placement of 2A peptide sequence as a linker region between tandem cDNA???s allows the stoichiometric translation of multiple unfused protein products. These sequences were first discovered in the foot-and-mouth disease virus (FMDV).And since than many 2A-like sequences have been identified in other viruses and some parasites.To minimize the risk of homologous recombination, it is important to use different 2A peptide sequences if more than two genes are being linked. The 2A peptide system has thus far worked successfully in all eukaryotic systems tested, from mammalian cells, yeast, and plants.In our project,we use F2A(from foot-and-mouth disease virus), P2A(from porcine teschovirus-1) and T2A(from Thosea asigna virus) to achieve our goal.And GSG linker is an oligopeptide of ???Gly-Ser-Gly??? between your protein and 2A peptide to enhance cleavage.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: We have to use it by chemosynthesis because the virus is dangerous.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Jie Li

prov:Activity.dcterms:title: iGEM to SBOL conversion
